title: Sample and Data Relationship Format for Proteomics (SDRF-Proteomics)
content:
// suppress inspection "GrazieInspection" for whole file
Sample and Data Relationship Format for Proteomics (SDRF-Proteomics)

//only works on some backends, not HTML

//use style like Section 1 when referencing within the document.

//GitHub specific settings

Status of this document

This document provides information to the proteomics community about a proposed standard for sample metadata annotations in public repositories called Sample and Data Relationship File (SDRF)-Proteomics format. Distribution is unlimited.

Version v1.1.0 - 2025-01

Abstract

The Human Proteome Organisation (HUPO) Proteomics Standards Initiative (PSI) defines community standards for data representation in proteomics to facilitate data comparison, exchange, and verification. This document presents a specification for the Sample and Data Relationship Format (SDRF-Proteomics).

Further detailed information, including any updates to this document, implementations, and examples is available at SDRF GitHub Repository. The official PSI web page for the document is the following: 

Motivation

Many resources have emerged that provide raw or integrated proteomics data in the public domain. If these are valuable individually, their integration through re-analysis represents a huge asset for the community .

Unfortunately, proteomics experimental design and sample related information are often missing in public repositories or stored in very diverse ways and formats. For example:

- The CPTAC Consortium provides for every dataset a set of Excel files with the information on each sample including tumor size, origin, but also how every sample is related to a specific raw file (e.g. instrument configuration parameters).

- As a resource routinely re-analysing public datasets, ProteomicsDB, captures for each sample in the database a minimum number of properties to describe the sample and the related experimental protocol such as tissue, digestion method and instrument.

Such heterogeneity often preven
keywords: FITNESS PRIDE ZFA AC PATCH TAB individual RECOMMENDED PRIDE:0000833 TMT cell type INCLUDING CPTAC RECOMMEND REQUIRED exclamation SILAC PRIDE:0000659 ANY age CS HCD MUST WARRANTY ancestry category CT collision energy PRIDE:0000831 biosample accession number BMC NCI REQUIRES CF NCIT MIAME LI PRIDE:0000834 MHC ... PS MAGE sex SDRF IDF SHOULD BTO INITIATIVE NCIT:C25683 XML VK WARRANTIES source name EFO DJ SN STANDARDS CL PRIDE:0000832 ISA README MAJOR SHALL ALL WILL CID MC SWATH AS PP TO PARTICULAR depletion THE dissociation method HANCESTRO MINOR DDA instrument XL TA SP organism RIGHTS alkylation reagent CN cleavage agent details RAW RFC pooled sample IMPLIED FOR INFORMATION spiked compound SAMEA EXPRESS organism part CLO PMID II SH USE HTML PSI PEPTIDESEQ technical replicate label HF characteristics PROTEOMICS MAY COLUMN OPTIONAL DIA MOD OR PATO:0000461 MONDO biological replicate INFRINGE NCIT:C25714 CV developmental stage MS:1001251 HUPO PRM PTM mass MT URI fraction identifier PO PURPOSE sample data file TIP file your VCF SRM BUT EM DTT BE III NOTE MERCHANTABILITY EW IAA ID NCE LC HEREIN OF MS fractionation method LIMITED IS PMCID JA EBI IMPORTANT disease SAMN proteomics data acquisition method UBERON QY NOT ROW CELL BRENDA NCBI reduction reagent URL THAT COULD FDR PATO ENVO DISCLAIMS NT

PS MAGE SDRF IDF SHOULD BTO INITIATIVE NCIT:C25683 VK WARRANTIES EFO DJ SN STANDARDS CL PRIDE:0000832 ISA README MAJOR SHALL ALL WILL CID MC SWATH AS PP TO PARTICULAR depletion THE dissociation method HANCESTRO MINOR DDA instrument XL TA SP organism RIGHTS alkylation reagent CN cleavage agent details RAW RFC pooled sample IMPLIED FOR INFORMATION spiked compound SAMEA EXPRESS organism part CLO PMID II SH USE HTML PSI PEPTIDESEQ technical replicate label HF PROTEOMICS MAY COLUMN OPTIONAL DIA MOD OR PATO:0000461 MONDO biological replicate INFRINGE NCIT:C25714 CV MS:1001251 HUPO PRM PTM mass MT URI fraction identifier PO PURPOSE data file VCF SRM BUT EM DTT BE III MERCHANTABILITY EW IAA NCE LC HEREIN OF MS fractionation method LIMITED IS PMCID JA EBI disease SAMN proteomics data acquisition method UBERON QY NOT ROW CELL BRENDA NCBI reduction reagent URL THAT COULD FDR PATO ENVO DISCLAIMS NT

title: Sample Metadata Guidelines
content:
Sample Metadata Guidelines

Introduction

This document provides guidelines for annotating general sample metadata in SDRF-Proteomics format. These guidelines apply to samples from any organism (human, animal, plant).

For human-specific metadata (disease staging, comorbidities, treatment history), see Human Sample Metadata Guidelines.

Version 1.0.0 - 2025-01

Organism

Column: characteristics[organism]

Ontology: NCBI Taxonomy (NCBITaxon)

Use the scientific name in lowercase. The validator will map to the correct ontology term.

Value |NCBITaxon ID |Description

homo sapiens |NCBITaxon:9606 |Human
mus musculus |NCBITaxon:10090 |Mouse

Organism Part / Tissue

Column: characteristics[organism part]

Ontology: UBERON for mammals/vertebrates, Plant Ontology (PO) for plants, FlyBase Anatomy (FBbt) for Drosophila.

Use lowercase for all values. For cell line samples, use not applicable or specify the tissue of origin (e.g., cervix for HeLa).

Value |UBERON ID |Description

blood |UBERON:0000178 |Whole blood
liver |UBERON:0002107 |Liver tissue

Age

Column: characteristics[age]

Format: {Number}{Unit} where Unit is: Y (Years), M (Months), W (Weeks), D (Days).

For age ranges use: {LowerBound}{Unit}-{UpperBound}{Unit} (e.g., 40Y-50Y).

Use not available when age is unknown, not applicable for immortalized cell lines.

Age Description |SDRF Value

40 years old |40Y
8 weeks old |8W

Developmental Stage

Column: characteristics[developmental stage]

Ontology: UBERON, EFO

Value |Description

adult |Sexually mature organism
embryonic |Pre-birth/pre-hatching

For model organisms, use specific stages when applicable: embryonic day 14 (mouse E14), 24 hpf (zebrafish 24 hours post fertilization).

Disease

Column: characteristics[disease]

Ontology: MONDO Disease Ontology (preferred), EFO, Human Disease Ontology (DOID)

Healthy Samples: normal vs healthy vs control

For samples without disease, the terminology matters for standardization:

normal (PATO:0000461) - Recommended

- S
keywords: PO organism CL:0000066 DOID EFO PDX MONDO:0005148 cell type synthetic peptide UBERON:0000178 APP NOTE exclamation age organism part CL ID PATO:0001421 MUST CL:0000815 disease UBERON:0002107 MAY UBERON MONDO:0004989 depletion CL:0000624 xenograft CL:0000084 enrichment process PATO:0000461 MONDO NCBI MONDO:0004975 SDRF developmental stage PTM PATO

content:
Sample Metadata Guidelines

Introduction

This document provides guidelines for annotating general sample metadata in SDRF-Proteomics format. These guidelines apply to samples from any organism (human, animal, plant).

Organism

Column: characteristics[organism]

Ontology: NCBI Taxonomy (NCBITaxon)

Value |NCBITaxon ID |Description

homo sapiens |NCBITaxon:9606 |Human

Ontology: UBERON for mammals/vertebrates, Plant Ontology (PO) for plants, FlyBase Anatomy (FBbt) for Drosophila.

Age Description |SDRF Value

40 years old |40Y

Column: characteristics[developmental stage]

Ontology: UBERON, EFO

Value |Description

adult |Sexually mature organism
embryonic |Pre-birth/pre-hatching

Column: characteristics[disease]

Ontology: MONDO Disease Ontology (preferred), EFO, Human Disease Ontology (DOID)

Healthy Samples: normal vs healthy vs control

For samples without disease, the terminology matters for standardization:

normal (PATO:0000461) - Recommended

- S
keywords: PO organism CL:0000066 DOID EFO PDX MONDO:0005148 cell type synthetic peptide UBERON:0000178 APP age organism part CL ID PATO:0001421 MUST CL:0000815 disease UBERON:0002107 MAY UBERON MONDO:0004989 depletion CL:0000624 xenograft CL:0000084 enrichment process PATO:0000461 MONDO NCBI MONDO:0004975 SDRF developmental stage PTM PATO

title: Human Sample Metadata Guidelines
content:
Human Sample Metadata Guidelines

Introduction

This document provides guidelines for annotating human-specific metadata in SDRF-Proteomics format. These guidelines apply to clinical studies and healthy human samples.

For general sample metadata (organism, age, sex, basic disease), see Sample Metadata Guidelines.

Version 1.0.0 - 2025-01

Disease Stage

Column: characteristics[disease stage]

Ontology: NCI Thesaurus (NCIT)

Value |NCIT ID |Description

stage I |NCIT:C27966 |Early localized disease
stage IV |NCIT:C27971 |Distant metastasis

Use not available when stage is unknown, not applicable for non-cancer samples.

TNM Staging

Column: characteristics[TNM staging]

Ontology: NCI Thesaurus (NCIT)

Format: T{0-4}N{0-3}M{0-1} where T = tumor size/extent, N = lymph node involvement, M = distant metastasis. Prefix p indicates pathological staging.

Value |Description

T1N0M0 |Small tumor, no nodes, no metastasis
pT2pN1M0 |Pathological staging after surgery

Tumor Grade

Column: characteristics[tumor grade]

Ontology: NCI Thesaurus (NCIT)

Value |NCIT ID |Description

grade 1 |NCIT:C28076 |Well differentiated
grade 3 |NCIT:C28078 |Poorly differentiated

Cancer-Specific Classifications

Breast cancer subtype (characteristics[breast cancer subtype]):

Value |NCIT ID |Description

luminal A |NCIT:C53554 |ER+/PR+, HER2-, low Ki67
triple-negative |NCIT:C71732 |ER-/PR-/HER2-

Other classifications: characteristics[Dukes stage] for colorectal cancer, characteristics[Ann Arbor stage] for lymphoma.

Pre-existing Condition

Column: characteristics[pre-existing condition]

Ontology: MONDO Disease Ontology

For multiple conditions, use multiple columns (preferred) or semicolon-separated values.

Condition |SDRF Value |MONDO ID

High blood pressure |hypertension |MONDO:0005044
Diabetes |type 2 diabetes mellitus |MONDO:0005148

Treatment

Column: characteristics[treatment]

Ontology: NCI Thesaurus (NCIT)

Value |NCIT ID |Description

chemotherapy |NCIT:C15632 |Chemical drug treatm
keywords: HIPAA treatment MONDO:0005044 individual MONDO:0005148 NCIT:C28076 TNM staging NCIT:C65107 breast cancer subtype pre-existing condition compound CHEBI:27899 NCIT:C15262 HANCESTRO:0005 menopausal status exclamation CHEBI:28748 IV organism part NCIT:C15632 NCIT:C71732 ID treatment status body mass index sampling time point NCIT:C4870 ancestry category NCIT:C65106 IMPORTANT NCI AJCC NCIT:C18206 GDPR NCIT smoking status dose Ann Arbor stage tumor grade HANCESTRO MONDO TNM treatment response Dukes stage SDRF HANCESTRO:0009 PR ER NCIT:C28078 NCIT:C65108 NCIT:C27971 disease stage NCIT:C27966 NCIT:C53554 weight

Condition |SDRF Value |MONDO ID

Column: characteristics[treatment]

Ontology: NCI Thesaurus (NCIT)

Value |NCIT ID |Description

chemotherapy |NCIT:C15632 |Chemical drug treatm
keywords: HIPAA treatment MONDO:0005044 individual MONDO:0005148 NCIT:C28076 TNM staging NCIT:C65107 breast cancer subtype pre-existing condition compound CHEBI:27899 NCIT:C15262 HANCESTRO:0005 menopausal status CHEBI:28748 IV organism part NCIT:C15632 NCIT:C71732 ID treatment status body mass index sampling time point NCIT:C4870 ancestry category NCIT:C65106 NCI AJCC NCIT:C18206 GDPR NCIT smoking status dose Ann Arbor stage tumor grade HANCESTRO MONDO TNM treatment response Dukes stage SDRF HANCESTRO:0009 PR ER NCIT:C28078 NCIT:C65108 NCIT:C27971 disease stage NCIT:C27966 NCIT:C53554 weight

title: Data File Metadata Guidelines
content:
Data File Metadata Guidelines

Introduction

This document provides detailed guidelines for data file metadata fields that require specific formatting or have complex standardization requirements. For basic field descriptions, see the main SDRF-Proteomics specification.

Version 1.0.0 - 2025-01

Label

Column: comment[label]

Ontology: PRIDE Ontology - Label

Describes the isotopic label applied to each sample.

Label-free: Use label free sample.

TMT labels: TMT126, TMT127N, TMT127C, TMT128N, TMT128C, TMT129N, TMT129C, TMT130N, TMT130C, TMT131N, TMT131C, TMT132N, TMT132C, TMT133N, TMT133C, TMT134N, TMT134C, TMT135N

iTRAQ labels: iTRAQ113, iTRAQ114, iTRAQ115, iTRAQ116, iTRAQ117, iTRAQ118, iTRAQ119, iTRAQ121

SILAC labels: SILAC light, SILAC medium, SILAC heavy

MS2 Analyzer Type

Column: comment[MS2 analyzer type]

Specifies the analyzer used for MS2 scans. Important for hybrid instruments.

Values: orbitrap, ion trap, quadrupole.

DIA Scan Window

Column: comment[MS1 scan range]

Format: {lower}m/z - {upper}m/z (e.g., 400m/z - 1200m/z)

Alternative: Use comment[scan window lower limit] and comment[scan window upper limit] as separate columns.

Protein Modifications

Column: comment[modification parameters]

Format: Key=value pairs: NT=ModificationName;AC=Accession;MT=Type;TA=AminoAcid;PP=Position

Property |Key |Description

Name |NT |Modification name (UNIMOD or PSI-MOD)
Accession |AC |UNIMOD or PSI-MOD accession

Common modifications:

Modification |Value

Carbamidomethyl (fixed) |NT=Carbamidomethyl;AC=UNIMOD:4;MT=Fixed;TA=C
Oxidation (variable) |NT=Oxidation;AC=UNIMOD:35;MT=Variable;TA=M

Cleavage Agents

Column: comment[cleavage agent details]

REQUIRED.

Format: NT=EnzymeName;AC=Accession

Enzyme |Value

Trypsin |NT=Trypsin;AC=MS:1001251
Lys-C |NT=Lys-C;AC=MS:1001309

For top-down/intact proteins, use not applicable. For multiple enzymes, add multiple columns.

Mass Tolerances

Columns: comment[precursor mass tolerance], comment[fragment mass tolerance]

Form
keywords: TA PRIDE scan window upper limit AC cleavage agent details TMT precursor mass tolerance MS:1001309 REQUIRED modification parameters exclamation SILAC MS1 scan range UNIMOD:4 README PSI MS label UNIMOD MS2 analyzer type UNIMOD:35 PP scan window lower limit DIA MOD fragment mass tolerance SDRF MS:1001251 MT NT

title: Data File Metadata Guidelines
content:
Data File Metadata Guidelines
